patterns: What can I expect from this class?
responses: Machine learning is a sub-field of Artificial Intelligence that gives computers the ability to learn and/or act without being explicitly programmed. Topics include various supervised, unsupervised and reinforcement learning approaches (including deep learning), optimization procedures, and statistical inference.
You will learn about Machine Learning in this class

patterns: What is the goal of this class?
Is there a goal for this class?
What can I learn in this class?
responses: The goal for this course is for the students will digest and practice their knowledge and skills by class discussion and exams, and obtain in-depth experience with a particular topic through a final project.

patterns: What is the grading policy of this class?
What is the policy for grades?
What grade do I need for an A?
responses: The grading policy is as follows: A = 100-90, B = 89-80, C = 79-70, D = 69-60, F = <60

patterns: What are the prerequisites of this class?
What courses do I need to take before this class?
What previous knowledge do I need?
responses: Students should have taken the following courses or equivalent: Data Structure and Algorithms (CSCE 221), Linear Algebra (MATH 304 or MATH 323), and Numerical Methods (MATH 417). Coding experiences with Python, Matlab, or C/C++ are assumed.Previous knowledge of machine learning, computer vision signal processing or data mining will be helpful, but not necessary.
Every student should attend the class, unless you have an accepted excuse. Please check student rule 7 http://student-rules.tamu.edu/rule07 for details.
Only univerisity excused absences will count as acceptable absences

patterns: What is the make up policy?
What happens if I miss class?
responses: If you have missed class, check the course website for what you have missed.
If you do not have a university excused absence, work cannot be made up

patterns: Can I work with others on homework?
responses: Aggie Code of Honor: An Aggie does not lie, cheat or steal, or tolerate those who do. see: http://aggiehonor.tamu.edu/
Aggies does not lie, cheat, or steal nor tolerate does who do.
If you cheat you will get an F

patterns: How can I do well in this class?
How can I get an A in this class?
What can I do to do better in this class?
I'm not doing well in this class, so how can I do better?
responses: Attend all the lectures, complete all assigned work and come to office hours
If you want to do well in this class you should attend all lectures, complete assigned work, and ask questions in class or in office hours
If you need more help with the material in this class, make an appointment with the professor or TA
